document.docAuthor: Ferrari, Rafael R., Niu, Ze-Qing, Kuhlmann, Michael, Zhang, Dan & Zhu, Chao- Dong
document.masterDocTitle: The cellophane bees of Colletes Latreille (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from Xizang (Tibet), China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The cellophane bees of Colletes Latreille (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from Xizang (Tibet), China

bibRefCitation.author: Cockerell, T. D. A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Cockerell, T. D. A. (1910) Some bees from high altitudes in the Himalaya mountains. The Entomologist, 43, 238 - 242. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. part. 28542

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Colletes sanctus
Cockerell, 1910: 241
( holotype ♀ : China , Xizang [NHMUK]).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Among the Tibetan
Colletes
, both sexes of
C. sanctus
are readily recognizable by hind basitarsus with dark setae and metasoma entirely black without basal and apical bands.
Colletes sanctus
is most similar to
C. sidemii
, however, they can be differentiated by the malar area 1.0× ( ♀ ) and 1.4× ( ♂ ) as long as basal width of mandible in the former (malar area 0.5× ( ♀ ) and 1.0× ( ♂ ) as long as basal width of mandible in the latter). Females of the two species can be further distinguished by the mesosoma covered with reddish-brown pubescence in
C. sanctus
(mesosoma with pale-orange pubescence in
C. sidemii
) and males by the S7 apicolateral lobe with neck subequal to disc in
C. sanctus
(neck much longer than disc in
C. sidemii
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 12.
Colletes paratibeticus Kuhlmann, 2002
. Female: (A) habitus, lateral view; (C) face, frontal view. Male: (B) habitus, lateral view; (D) face, frontal view; (E) genital capsule, lateral view; (F) S7, ventral view. Scale bars: (A–D) 2 mm; (E, F) 1 mm.

FIGURE 13. Confirmed geographic records of the
Colletes species
found in Xizang based on the examined material. (A)
C. paratibeticus
; (B)
C. sanctus
; (C)
C. sidemii
; (D)
C. splendidus
sp. nov.

Distribution. Western China ( Sichuan and Xizang ) and northern India ( Sikkim ).
DNA barcode. Available ( 4 ♀ and 6 ♂ ). See also Fig. 1 and Table 1 .

Floral hosts. Leguminosae:
Astragalus sinicus
L.; Thymelaeaceae :
Stellera chamaejasme
L.

Remarks.
Colletes sanctus
was by far the most abundant species of the genus among the material collected in Xizang between 2014–2020, corresponding to roughly one third (688 of 2050) of the specimens.
